text: Alessandro Strozzi (died 1621) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Archbishop of Fermo (1606–1621). (in Latin)"Archdiocese of Fermo" Catholic- Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved October 7, 2016"Metropolitan Archdiocese of Fermo" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved October 7, 2016 ==Biography== On 10 April 1606, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Paul V as Archbishop of Fermo. He served as Archbishop of Fermo until his death in 1621. While bishop, he was the principal co-consecrator of Paolo Emilio Sfondrati, Bishop of Cremona (1607). == References == Category:17th- century Roman Catholic archbishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Paul V Category:1621 deaths
title: Alessandro Strozzi (archbishop of Fermo)
